    • Method Detail

      • setHosts

        public HostTypes.FilterSpec.Builder setHosts(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> hosts)
        Identifiers of hosts that can match the filter. If null or empty, hosts with any identifier match the filter.
        Parameters:
        hosts - New value for the property. When clients pass a value of this class as a parameter, the property must contain identifiers for the resource type: HostSystem. When methods return a value of this class as a return value, the property will contain identifiers for the resource type: HostSystem.

      • setNames

        public HostTypes.FilterSpec.Builder setNames(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> names)
        Names that hosts must have to match the filter (see HostTypes.Summary.getName()). If null or empty, hosts with any name match the filter.
        Parameters:
        names - New value for the property.

      • setFolders

        public HostTypes.FilterSpec.Builder setFolders(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> folders)
        Folders that must contain the hosts for the hosts to match the filter. If null or empty, hosts in any folder match the filter.
        Parameters:
        folders - New value for the property. When clients pass a value of this class as a parameter, the property must contain identifiers for the resource type: Folder. When methods return a value of this class as a return value, the property will contain identifiers for the resource type: Folder.

      • setDatacenters

        public HostTypes.FilterSpec.Builder setDatacenters(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> datacenters)
        Datacenters that must contain the hosts for the hosts to match the filter. If null or empty, hosts in any datacenter match the filter.
        Parameters:
        datacenters - New value for the property. When clients pass a value of this class as a parameter, the property must contain identifiers for the resource type: Datacenter. When methods return a value of this class as a return value, the property will contain identifiers for the resource type: Datacenter.

      • setStandalone

        public HostTypes.FilterSpec.Builder setStandalone(java.lang.Boolean standalone)
        If true, only hosts that are not part of a cluster can match the filter, and if false, only hosts that are are part of a cluster can match the filter. If null Hosts can match filter independent of whether they are part of a cluster or not. If this field is true and HostTypes.FilterSpec.getClusters() os not empty, no hosts will match the filter.
        Parameters:
        standalone - New value for the property.

      • setClusters

        public HostTypes.FilterSpec.Builder setClusters(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> clusters)
        Clusters that must contain the hosts for the hosts to match the filter. If null or empty, hosts in any cluster and hosts that are not in a cluster match the filter. If this property is not empty and HostTypes.FilterSpec.getStandalone() is true, no hosts will match the filter.
        Parameters:
        clusters - New value for the property. When clients pass a value of this class as a parameter, the property must contain identifiers for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource. When methods return a value of this class as a return value, the property will contain identifiers for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.

      • setConnectionStates

        public HostTypes.FilterSpec.Builder setConnectionStates(java.util.Set<HostTypes.ConnectionState> connectionStates)
        Connection states that a host must be in to match the filter (see HostTypes.Summary.getConnectionState(). If null or empty, hosts in any connection state match the filter.
        Parameters:
        connectionStates - New value for the property.

      • build

        public HostTypes.FilterSpec build()
